title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a file is opened in one editor, attempting to open the same file in another editor does not produce any outcome or error message.
EB: However, there should be a warning or error message indicating that the file is already open in another editor.
SR:
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your Java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' followed by 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will appear with the Java file opened. Close this window.
3. Go back to the Java Perspective and open a Java file by double clicking on it.
4. Right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' followed by 'System Editor'.

Expected: The workbench should display a warning message stating that you may overwrite changes and asking if you want to continue, or an error message indicating that you should close all files first.

Additionally, we believe this behavior is a safety feature where the software does not allow external editing while a file is already opened within the software.
